abstract: Army releases report exonerating Ford Hood Army base leaders of 2014 shooting rampage that left three solders dead and 12 others wounded before shooter, Specialist Ivan A Lopez, killed himself; says officials had no clear warning that Lopez posed a threat.
lead_paragraph: Officials at the base in central Texas could not have predicted a shooting rampage last year in part because the troubled soldier behind the attack gave no clear warning that he posed a threat, according to an Army report.
snippet: Officials at the base in central Texas could not have predicted a shooting rampage last year in part because the troubled soldier behind the attack gave no clear warning that he posed a threat, according to an Army report.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: Fort Hood Could Not Have Foreseen 2014 Gun Attack, Army Says
headline.print_headline: Fort Hood Could Not Have Foreseen 2014 Gun Attack, Army Says
